Note:
Possibly a modified carol in four stanzas and introductory burden: ‘No comfortyng but yow’. See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 2037.
_description: ‘No comfortyng but yow’ — five 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas

BLAdd31922.First Lines: Wher be ye my loue my loueand where be ye gone…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …And god abouekepe your louefor you haue myne alone
BLAdd31922.Note: Words and notation repeated for three singing voices.
